knowledge: X . In mathematics, "x" is commonly used as the name for an independent variable or unknown value. The modern tradition of using "x" to represent an unknown was introduced by René Descartes in "La Géométrie" (1637). As a result of its use in algebra, X is often used to represent unknowns in other circumstances (e.g. X-rays, Generation X, "The X-Files", and "The Man from Planet X"; see also Malcolm X).
